page.title: 10Castle Hill Footpath,Rutland
page.content: Leading off from the top of the Leicester Road there is an unindicated footpath beginning at an old wooden gate.The footpath follows the course of a stream westwards along the bottom of a small valley;and passes to the north of Castle Hill,which is the old site of a Motte and Bailey castle. The footpath although unmarked as such,passes through pasture land,providing a pleasant scenic route.Near the stream there are clumps of gorse,which is uncommon locally.Further on down the path,it has been blocked by a new conifer wood plantation surrounded by an electric fence.This unsigned footpath and the blockages are common problems in this area.
